website_summaries.verdict: Spacious enough for the average-sized batch of chili or soup, this reliable pressure cooker is an excellent starting point if you want to try near-effortless cooking.
pros: Convenient settings include auto-warm, sauté, low or high pressure, and simmer
Handles stay cool to the touch
cons: You’ll wish that you had the 8-quart model if you need the cooking space later

customer_reviews.title: I would like a refund for $48 shipping fees for the defective ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought pressure cooker with insurance. The cooker is defective... timer does not work and cooker shuts down. Insurance states it is under warranty. Warranty told me ship it back to Cuisinart for a replacement which costs $48 for shipping! That is more than half of what I paid for the item. I would like a refund for $48 shipping fees for the defective item. NO positive review until resolved! HELP
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Woodrow

customer_reviews.title: It was great...then stop working:(
customer_reviews.text: Hello, we got this Pressure Cooker and it was great for 6 months, then it stop working. I sent an email to product support but they didn't answer. I am hoping that the Customer Service Department answers so we can resolve this and get a fix. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Manuela Canotilho

customer_reviews.title: Positively a wonderful machine. Steams vegetables quickly and to perfection
customer_reviews.text: Positively a wonderful machine. Steams vegetables quickly and to perfection, does whole grain brown rice flawlessly every time in 22 min - does dry beans (washed) right out of the bag in 50. Just YouTube Instant Pot anything and you will have a wealth of information.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Karlos

customer_reviews.title: Top Handle Splits from Pressure - AGAIN!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are downgrading our review of this cooker. It has worked well but we’ve gone through 2 of them due to shoddy design or manufacturing, for the same reason. Eventually, the lid handle splits and the pressure escapes in places and ways that it shouldn’t. We use our pressure cooker weekly but not for anything major (collards, smoked meats, rabbit). It’s never a lot of food. We should get many years of use out of these but this is our second one. We give up on Cuisinart. Clearly not a product/company for frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best appliances I have ever hoped for! I can cook without heating up my whole house with the oven, and HOLY FAST COOKING TIME! its so easy to use AND clean as well. It may not have as many features as other brands, but I just didn't need all of those. I have been raving about it to everyone! My only hang up is the instruction and recipe book that came with it. I looked up some youtube videos to see exactly how to work it, but the actual pressure cooker is absolutely fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Karlidoll

customer_reviews.title: good time saver!
customer_reviews.text: This cuts down on cooking time. boiled potatoes in 10 minutes, perfectly cooked rice in 7, hard boiled eggs in 3 minutes on pressure. Roasts and chicken come out really great. With always being on the go, this is a great gadget for the kitchen to save on some time. Easy to clean and I like the little meat rack that you can take out when you need the whole bowl. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. PAB

customer_reviews.title: Good brand, good look
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart is one of the top brands - part of the reason I bought it. There were no complicated instructions - a simple how to use manual with recipes. Easy setup, easy use, easy clean up. Even the toughest meats are made tender in this cooker. I've tried others which have a multitude of push buttons for every conceivable circumstance. - they are confusing and I never used half the buttons. The Cuisinart is simple to set and simple to use. If you like ribs, you're going to love this machine. Cook'em, brush them with sauce, put under the broiler (or on grill) and in minutes you have fall off the bone ribs! Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Didn't wh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter two years ago. It worked great for the first 2 times, but it hasn't worked at all since then. I've had another brand for the same two years with no problems at all. I'm sorry I wasted money on this one. I'm very disappointed with Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: "Charlie"

customer_reviews.title: So convenient everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much that when I left it on my stove and it caught on fire about midnight from my burner being on. The next day was Black Friday so after the smoke cleared I got online and found this of a great deal. You know after a fire, the fire department being here and my house being with smoke filled that I must really love this pressure cooker to have gotten online at 4 AM after no sleep and ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: Jules66

customer_reviews.title: Happy With My New Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cuisinart instead of the Instant Pot because of one thing: This model browns meat while most do not have this feature. I've taken this through its paces and I'm really pleased with my purchase. We've made a stew with the pressure cooking feature. We have made chili con queso, green bean casserole and a variety of other dishes. The instructions are easy-to-follow and this Cuisinart offers a variety of different recipes.
customer_reviews.author: JJares

customer_reviews.title: Must Have in the Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I received one as a wedding gift a few years ago and LOVE it and use it all the time! It produces the most moist tender meats! I ended up buying one as a Christmas gift for my mom because she was so interested since I use mine a lot. My two favorite features are it’s a breeze to clean, and once it cooks your meal...it keeps it warm for 12hrs! So a lot of times I’ll start it while we’re gone, then when we get home we have a perfect meal just waiting for us!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt hold pressure out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it looked like it had decent reviews on here. The very first try out of the box the pressure cooker would not hold pressure. It would start to build up pressure but it would just leak it out of the main valve and switch right to warming mode. I tried to adjust the seal inside a couple times and didnt make a difference. I looked on here at some of the one and two star reviews and it looked like others have had the same issue. Im going to spend the extra money and go with the instant pot instead.
customer_reviews.author: jeffavs21

customer_reviews.title: This cooker is great for doing so many meals
customer_reviews.text: This cooker is great for doing so many meals. We use ours all the time primarily for beans and pulled pork. It makes a mean soup and will cook down bones into a great bone broth. The remaining bones are so soft after being cooked that they can be crushed with a potato masher and fed to our dogs. Check with your vet before doing this yourself as it introduces a lot of calcium to their diet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The non stick pot cleans up very easily, and I think that it is probably safe ...
customer_reviews.text: This works as promised. I mainly cook dried beans in it, which takes about 30 minutes at pressure. The non stick pot cleans up very easily, and I think that it is probably safe since the non stick coating won't heat over 250 degrees F (the max temp the pot gets under pressure), which is well below the dangerous temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Clarisse Emily Noel

customer_reviews.title: Fearless cooker
customer_reviews.text: I was able to observe a friend using her cooker before buying one myself. I like that once you've programmed the desired settings, it doesn't need watching or listening to. My only complaint is that the directions in the book fail to mention that , i.e., when you go from simmer (as in rice pudding) to pressure, you need to push the start button again. My first attempt at rice pudding produced a mixture that would probably successfully plaster an exterior wall. Now I get it, and feel comfortable cooking many things. A good safety feature is the inner lid that prevents bits of beans or rice from clogging the pressure hole. So I feel confident that it won't explode.
customer_reviews.author: KatieDid

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pressure cooker for 6 years. Just recently I've been having a problem of the little red safety valve not sealing completely when starting to cook. It'll hiss until I smack it a couple times. Other than that, it's worked flawlessly over the years. I use it maybe 3-4 times a month, sometimes more. I put the lid into the dishwasher as well as the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I’m Johnny come lately to the electric cooker party. This has been the best purchase we have made. It is super easy to get going and to has been great to use at least twice a week. The included instructions are written easy to understand. It has allowed us to have healthy delicious meals during the week. Our take out bill has dropped to virtually nothing and the meat is tender and flavorful. It amazes me how the seasonings are infused into the meat in a short amount of time. Why didn’t I get this a year ago??
customer_reviews.author: tweaka

customer_reviews.title: The perfect kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using mine for 4 years now, and it works perfect every time. I cook oatmeal and other grains in it. Got rid of the rice cooker I owned. Is great for all sorts of foods. So many great recipes online. Can't live without this!!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: We like it, except for the fact that it takes ...
customer_reviews.text: We like it, except for the fact that it takes about 15 minutes for it to start cooking. So yes, it's a pressure cooker, but when a recipe takes 7 minutes to cook, you have to consider another 15 minutes or so for the machine to get ready to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pressure cooker! I was intimidated when I first bought it but after a couple of weeks I pulled it out of the box and decided to conquer my fear of it. I am so glad I did. I have used it numerous times since I purchased it and everything has been absolutely wonderful tasting. The instructions/cookbook that comes with it leaves a lot to be desired, but after looking on Pinterest, watching You Tube videos and purchasing a cookbook from Amazon, I am no longer afraid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy an instapot instead
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working. Tried contacting customer support, they said it was past warranty so basically there was nothing they could do about it. Purchased an instapot instead, so much better.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Purchased one 2 years ago and love it. I purchased this one as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one 2 years ago and love it. I purchased this one as a gift. I now have given all of my family one of these pressure cookers and everyone just loves it! If you want to cook great meals in a very short time this is for you! I don't have to get up early to get everything ready for an evening meal. I can now wait until I get home from work to get started and have a fabulous meal for dinner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Addition
customer_reviews.text: I've used Pressure cookers for years, but never an electric one. This one is so simple to use, I wonder why I didn't purchase it before. Just plug it in and it even keeps time. As always, pressure cooked food is super nutritious and super tasting as all the flavor is locked in. What I like about this is I can even take in and use it in my Motorhome. It's also super easy to clean. Not sure I can say anything bad about this. If you want to cook fast and easy and have great meals, get this!
customer_reviews.author: Castleriggpekes

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: We had a very early example of this exact model from Cuisinart which we used for years, and loved it. Alas, we ruined it in an accident. We were pleased to find that it is still sold, so we bought it, knowing it would work like the old one AND knowing that the quality engineering and construction would serve us once again. Thanks, Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hunyady

customer_reviews.title: I just bought this unit and as many others have ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this unit and as many others have said, there were issues with the pressure valve. Due to a design flaw where the pressure valve sticks open, the unit never pressurized. Steam escapes the entire time and eventually just switches to "keep warm". When I looked up the error, I found forum posts where this issue runs rampant. I'm buying a different model.
customer_reviews.author: CL or JG

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and received this, but it worked perfect to cook pork, then chicken. We owned another model that had a plastic pressure relief, which broke every couple of months. Once the warranty ran out and they stopped sending us replacement pressure relief valves, we purchased this, which is much better built and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great results - when it works, that is!
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product if it worked consistently. The nonstick inner pan is great, and it's easy to use. However, I'm finding that a common complaint with this product is that for some reason, it likes to overheat and shut off mid-cook! As you can imagine, this not only renders it unreliable, but also useless. I had high hopes for this product, too, as it came highly recommended by America's Test Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Laowai16

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally good cooker
customer_reviews.text: Our old Cuisinart finally broke after 6 years so we tried an Instant Pot upgrade. That was a big mistake and we ended up just buying a new Cuisinart. This cooker works extremely well, it is easy to operate, and cleans quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Met

customer_reviews.title: Recommend very highly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for eight years now, and it still looks and cooks like brand new, so I can't understand why all of the negative reviews. I've made so many delicious dishes in this over the years and have never had a problem with any of them or the pressure cooker. I can't recommend it more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont make cuisinart first go to item
customer_reviews.text: I have alway picked cuisinart products first this one disappointed not working already got instapot now happy now have two separate cuisinart items im unhappy with
customer_reviews.author: Rita Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Use it All the time
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Keeps from having tons of steam blowing out all over the place as with a stove top pressure pot. Do not have to keep resetting burner heat to pressure up. This brings to pressure and holds well with only the tinyest amount of steam blowing out as well as flavor loss. Cooks very fast using pressure and is safer than the older stove top pressure pots. Easy clean up and great flavors from this cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dale A. Stagg

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY ANY CUISINART PRESSURE COOKER!!!! Worst product EVER. I rarely do reviews, but this one is necessary. Bought it, used it a few times, never worked well (food was always rubbery. It sat in the cupboard until I needed it today and now it doesn't work - just shuts off after 5 minutes. Don't water your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I gave one of these to everyone on staff for Christmas last year. It was very worthwhile. We compare recipes, techniques and make dinner time go quickly. Roasts can go from frozen to fall apart in 99 minutes. BBQ chicken can go from frozen to on the table in 12 minutes. I highly recommend this product and recommend you have a friend that will cook along with you. Comparing and reviewing makes meal making a much easier task and you will love the fact that this is a quiet product! It is not noisy and terrible on the nerves.
customer_reviews.author: THoward

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Haven’t used slow cooker since we got it!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for over a year now and still love it! It has only done something weird a few times where it scortches rice on the bottom but I am pretty positive it is because I am cooking something beforehand and not letting it cool down sufficiently before throwing the rice in!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Greatest invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is very well made and easy to use. I have made roasts, chicken, and soups and have not had a dinner my family didn't love. It makes great roasts in less that an hour. I work long hours and take care of my elderly dad. I can come home and have dinner on the table in an hour. The quality is good, it's easy to clean. I especially like to use it in the summer when I want to make something in the oven but don't really want to heat up the kitchen for hours while I'm cooking something that takes a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best things I have ever purchased myself
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have ever purchased myself. I am a single mom with 2 busy kids. Some nights it is a daunting task to think about what to fix for dinner. This makes it a little (in some cases a lot) faster. I am looking for ward to trying lots of new recipes with it. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Bowden

customer_reviews.title: Home Cooking at its Finest!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best Beef Stroganoff I've had since I was a little girl! I'very been wanting a pressure cooker for many years, but wasn't sure how to choose a really good, SAFE one. This fits the bill and is perfect for me. No more worrying about the chicken being done enough, WITHOUT worrying about drying it out in the meantime. Easy clean-up, and a good pressure cooker cookbook will help you learn how to convert over from oven and stove-top cooking. Great deal, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product has been awesome. We can cook frozen chicken breasts in about ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has been awesome. We can cook frozen chicken breasts in about 11 minutes. Rice in about 10 minutes. Great for busy households. My only drawback in cleaning the inside lid and when you release the steam, use caution.
customer_reviews.author: BellaTracy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Buy This.
customer_reviews.text: This is a repurchase for me. I lost my first one due to me being stupid. I had to buy another one. The results are amazing. You can sear meat, sautée, and then pressure cook. I love it. Instapot is all the rave but this does exactly the same thing. You just have to google recipes and figure out your cook times.
customer_reviews.author: MrMike

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pressure cooker a few years ago from Amazon. I love using it. Makes things simple, delicious and healthy. I only have 2 burners on my stove (and a grill) so I didn't want one for the stove. This is easy to use, easy to clean. It's amazing how lesser cuts of meat can become so tender so quickly. The front panel is clear and simple to understand. Would suggest double checking the position of the steam vent, however. I have not lined it up correctly and so the food did not pressurize. Now that I am used to it, it's no big deal. Love the non-stick interior, too! This machine is only second to my crockpot!
customer_reviews.author: Melibea

customer_reviews.title: Unique Pressure Cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Before cooker arrived I worried that I would regret this purchase. Was I ever wrong! I fell in love with my cooker before I opened the box. I used this cooker several times now and I am still highly impressed with it. I am pleased with all the recipes I have tried in it. The cooker's beautiful style fits in both modern and traditional kitchens. It cooks both quickly and quietly ( definitely not like my parents' pressure cooker!). The cooked food turns out great! I love my Cuisinart! Its easy to set and unbelievably easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: L.E.S

customer_reviews.title: This cooker  is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pressure cooker. I bought it because I've always wanted one and memories of my mom's pressure cooker with it's happily chattering vent weight always make me smile. This one is quiet, but what comes out is just as good if not better. I've made pot roasts, bbq short ribs, pea soup and more in mine so far. It cleans up well. The directions are clear. The recipes in the booklet are so-so but there is no lack of pressure cooker ideas on the web. This will be my 'go to' gift for weddings et al for quite a while. I am so happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Keto_minded

customer_reviews.title: Nice easy to use and makes great recipies
customer_reviews.text: great cooker - makes just the right amount for several meals for the two of us. Easy to clean and use. The keep warm function and timer means you don't have to hang around and watch or wait for it to finish unless you are using the fast pressure release.
customer_reviews.author: FGR

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: i felt confident in buying a Cuisinart product. This product was used 2 times, unfortunately 2 weeks after the return date. Only once could I complete the process after 5 attempts. . When attempting to start the process of cooking the second time, it would not start until I had repeated my try 20 times! Then when I added other ingredients after 10 minutes, it would not work again. A real waste of time and food!
customer_reviews.author: Marv in PA

customer_reviews.title: I am extremly happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give 4 stars instead of 5 because of the quality of the pot that is inside. I was careful not to scratch the surface with any tablespoons so I used plastic or wooden spoons. However after a year the inside is scratched. I have bought stainless steel replacement from amazon so I do not have to deal with this problem again. I would also wish the designers of this cooker to improve its design so it will be easier to clean inside on the top around the reams as it is difficult to get the food parts from there.
customer_reviews.author: MBLOND

customer_reviews.title: GREAT pressure cooker. A++++
customer_reviews.text: I have a traditional aluminum pressure cooker with that little jiggly thing on top but found it very difficult to work correctly on my electric stove top. When I saw the Cuisinart electric I bought it immediately. I'm glad I did. This is so much easier than the manual stove top unit. It's basically "set it and forget it". I like how it automatically goes into a keep warm state after cooking. Cleanup is super easy as well. This is a very well made unit. I highly recommend this to anyone whether you are new to pressure cookers or a seasoned pro.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pressure cooker for over a year now and I can certainly say: I am as satisfied today as I was when first started using it. I have used it to pressure cook a lot of corn on the comb and it is a success each time. Also, I have browned large pieces of meat and then pressure cooked them. The inside of each piece will be well cooked (just regulate the time properly). Plus, I feel safe using this product. Overall, I would certainly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LEFA

customer_reviews.title: Defective lid handle.  Cooks great.
customer_reviews.text: Lid material is crinkling. It’s defective. Factory wants me to pay $15 to ship lid back before they’ll send me a new one. Cooks great though.
customer_reviews.author: llamawoman60

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Easy to use and meals are perfect every time.
customer_reviews.text: These things are the greatest invention in awhile! We purchased one a few years ago and use it regularly in the winter to make a crock pot style meal in less than an hour. Bought another as a gift this past year because it was so handy. Cuisinart makes a quality product you can count on and this one is no different. Has all the options along with a great instruction booklet. Easy to clean and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: taytaydoggirl

customer_reviews.title: Everything's Great But The Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for less than a month and used it a couple of times, but it delivers as advertised -- it's easy to operate, cooks rapidly, creates great tasting food and is easy to clean. I am very satisfied with it, but if it had not been for info contained in other Amazon reviews, I might still be trying to assemble it for first use. The instructions are vague and the illustrations insufficiently specific. Cuisinart should revise their manual, incorporating the helpful hints of Amazon reviewers. Thanks to all of you who spelled out in detail how to put the appliance together properly.
customer_reviews.author: lyn p.

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure cooker. I got this because I learned that pressure cookers could not be used on ceramic stove tops because they cause cracking. This was perfect because it can cook and be put on a timer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan DeValdivielso

customer_reviews.title: Best pressure cooker ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Cuisinart. I tried other pressure cookers but I keep coming back to Cuisinart. What I like about it is it easy to use, you can set your own time for cooking, and it's durable. I cooked meat, vegetables, and rice. All of the meals turned out excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. J

customer_reviews.title: Better to saute in a side pan and add that ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth it's weight in gold in terms of usefulness. One tech glitch the manufacturer needs to fix. If you saute or brown in the pot per directions, the thermostat locks out using pressure settings until it entirely cools down. Better to saute in a side pan and add that to the pressure pot.
customer_reviews.author: UCFan79

customer_reviews.title: Need better instructions/cooking guides
customer_reviews.text: The instructions provided aren't very clear. I've never used a pressure cooker before and I constantly have to google how to cook something. Wish there was more clear cut instructions on how to cook fresh and frozen meats (ex: how long to cook for, whether you should use the rack or not, etc). Also, I don't even understand the browning feature and other features like that...
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The Only Limitation is Your Imagination!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart electric pressure cooker. My first one still works as if brand new, but the removable cooking vessel's Teflon coating was scratched and coming off. The cost to replace the cooking vessel wasn't worth the cost compared to simply purchasing a whole new pressure cooker. I use my pressure cooker to make soups, pasta dishes, stews, fried rice.....just about everything. The only limitation is your imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: Does all that it promised to do. And performs with a high safety net, too. The "Browning" pre-pressure setting works out spectacularly. The pressurized cooking is obviously well-calibrated. We choose to let the pressure go down slowly and then have the machine turn on its "KEEP warm" function. That the inner cooking pot goes into the dishwasher is an appreciated positive feature. We have learned to be very careful and thorough when cleaning the sealing mechanism. That operation with the valve is what makes this Cuisinart work very well for us. For home use for a small family, this kitchen device has proven to be a real plus item.
customer_reviews.author: M. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not pressurizing correctly. Turns it's self off until you monkey around with the lid.= Dangerous to do
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the exact pressure cooker I had since 2010. The "seal" on this one looks thinner. I noticed this when I tried to use it and it wouldn't keep pressure. I have to "monkey around" with the lid once it starts hissing - because there is no way to tell if it's going to pressure up correctly, until it doesn't. Oh my! So the box went with the trashman and I'm stuck with having to stand around for a while to make sure the thing is going to pressurize properly. Ugg!
customer_reviews.author: Renea

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: She loves it. Makes a tough cut if meat tender.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hills

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this model for about a year and have been very pleased with the way it works. We found out that our oldest daughter has been wanting to try an electric pressure cooker so for her birthday this year we decided to surprise her with one. The reason we originally bought ours was due to previous experience with Cuisinart products. We have always found the quality of this brand to be excellant. This along with price were the major considerations for ordering this model pressure cooker. We have several years of experience with electric pressure cooking and we would never go back to the gas method.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how much cooking time is saved and still able ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how much cooking time is saved and still able to prepare healthy meals. I have recommended it to several of my friends to try and definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a pressure cooker. Family loves the meals I've prepared in it so far. I was always skeptical of regular pressure cookers but this one is easy to use, just plug it in set the timer and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooker--Great beans with chili.
customer_reviews.text: We bought as many Cusinart electric pressure cookers as we could find in our local community (before we discovered Amazon) to give one to each of our 7 married children plus one for ourselves. Recently we dropped the pot on a concrete floor and knocked it out of round. What did we do? We immediately ordered another Cusinart. We love it! And we love the great beans my husband cooks with genuine dried red chili pods and green jalapeno added. Except for my husbands clumsy hands that dropped the pot, our old cooker has given us about 5 years of steady and completely satisfactory service. Thank you Cusinart and now thanks for selling them on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Yerda Payne

customer_reviews.title: the wait time of 15 minutes to speak to customer service was a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a 0 rating I would. Nothing on the control panel worked as it should and the instructions were no help. For that matter, the wait time of 15 minutes to speak to customer service was a waste of time. When I got through to customer service they simple told me that the timer and possibly the entire control panel was defective. Safe yourself some time and money and don't buy this product or read the other reviews and then decide. As for myself, I've decided to stick with a crockpot.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: The Best Appliance You Never Knew You Needed!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this as a gift to a family member after discovering that she didn't have one. She is the cook in the family, always organizing family gatherings, holidays, etc. Well she absolutely LOVES it! And she's not just saying she loves it because we gave it to her. Lately, they've been using it almost every day to make things. I have to say, I don't recall anyone being so enthralled with a kitchen appliance. She calls it "the best appliance I never knew I needed!"
customer_reviews.author: Rohlfie

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift for someone
customer_reviews.text: Although I'm not the owner of this, but, bought this for someone else. Tasted their cooking using the pressure cooker. Its pretty good. They made soups, chicken, stews, beef, and many other stuff. Pressure cooker is a great way to cut down time as I've heard from many others and although I wouldn't say this is the best of its kind. It serves its purpose and food comes out good. Cuts a good portion of time and makes the meat more tender (depending on the cook).
customer_reviews.author: J. Au

customer_reviews.title: Today, I'm making my first meal in my new ...
customer_reviews.text: Today, I'm making my first meal in my new 6 qt Cuisinart. : a pot roast with vegetables. Here's the problem: the ACTUAL receipe is in the BIG COOKBOOK that comes with the "Instruction Booklet". They are NOT THE SAME INSTRUCTIONS! I'm working with hot steam here...this is scary. The COOKBOOK pictures something called "Instant Pot" which has a different front;different buttons. Two of us took a LONG TIME figuring it out. Cuisinart should be smarter about this. Lee, St. Louis,MO
customer_reviews.author: SUE COLE

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Crock-Pot... It was nice knowing you!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ate with his eyes closed. After 19 years together I've never seen him do that. We love how all of the flavors fused to each other, yet they retained their own flavor. Best pot roast ever. Everything cooked perfectly with great texture. So easy to use and cooked in a fraction of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Price

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pressure cooker! I grew up with my parents using the old fashioned stove-top pressure cookers. I have used the large canning pressure cookers in the past too. What an improvement this one is! It plugs into the wall, you add your ingredients, and about 15 minutes later - voila! A delicious meal! We have cooked two dishes with it so far and the taste is better than our stove top recipe. It is so easy to use and so EASY TO CLEAN! Hurray! Thank you Cuisinart :)
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Packaging buyer be careful.
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a new one we put it away in the box when we went to pick it up the entire bottom of the box broke and the product crashed to the floor and was ruined...It was a gift from my mom and I was mad I had to replace it and pay for a new one because some bone head doesn't know how to package a product. Beware when the label on the front says NEW PACKAGING DESIGN...seriously!
customer_reviews.author: D. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Pot
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is so amazing. We can get dinner done in about 45 minutes and everything is so delicious. In these times, I would think that EVERY kitchen would have one. However, I have to say that the instructions are a little fuzzy. However, I am used to using a stove top cooker, so I was able to compensate. However, if someone were to try this without previous experience, I think they would get a little lost. BETTER instructions and recipes are NECESSARY.
customer_reviews.author: John Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Very minimal functionality, coating tore off after 3 uses. Handle fell apart after 6 months of use too much heat
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: I guess you would say we really like this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2010 and purchased 3 more for gifts. All are used all the time, with no problems. I am getting ready to buy 3 more for gifts. I guess you would say we really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is complicated to use but when it works it's wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I still have trouble figuring out how to use this, because it isn't always clear but otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Straus

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive used it several times already to make BBQ chicken, BBQ ribs and beef stew. Havent had any issues as of yet. Does everything I thought it would! The browning feature is a godsend. Easy to clean too. Just an all around great product. I recommend getting some cookbooks too. Its a little of a learning curve when cooking delicate vegetables. It will take a little getting used to if you're new to the game, but i highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: HarlemKnightz

customer_reviews.title: excellent addition to the kitchen gadget collection.
customer_reviews.text: first thing we tried this on was a roast that would normally take several hours in the crock pot. took right at an hour. but unlike crock pot. it came out tender, juicy and you could pull it apart with a fork.
customer_reviews.author: cforcht

customer_reviews.title: I got this for Christmas, 2013, and am impressed so far.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before deciding which pressure cooker Santa might have in mind for me. This one is very easy to use. I have made a variety of items, each of which was easy. Restarting pressure if I cooked too briefly is very easy and quick. Also cleanup is very easy. I bought a couple of cookbooks to help, and read suggestions in those as well as in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Becky O

customer_reviews.title: It is easy and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. It is easy and versatile. It makes many recipes that used to take hours cook in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: elisabeth  Brockie

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was 8qt
customer_reviews.text: Pressure cooker works as advertised. Only issue is capacity. We had an 8qt electric pressure cooker but the inner pot began peeling and we had to replace it. The new one is only 6qt in size and it doesn't allow us to put in the same amount of meat to feed our family of six. We hear rumors that QVC is going to sell an 8qt version this fall. The Denis pressure cooker is 8qt but is has terrible reviews from people that purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: JAG50

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the inside non stick scrapped off within 1 day of use
customer_reviews.author: G.N

customer_reviews.title: a great pot!
customer_reviews.text: Great pot, most recently I made black bean soup and love that i can start with dry beans not cans.
customer_reviews.author: Fizyka Pomaga

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it and because she is an exceptional cook and knows how to use it, I also love it. ;)
customer_reviews.author: James Cox

customer_reviews.title: great cooker!
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker was a gift for my grandmother, she saw it at a different retailer for a different price, so I started my own search on Amazon of course, and came across the same pressure cooker for such a better price. when she opend this on christmas her mouth flew open and she grabbed her face in shock that my sister and I havd bought htis pressure cooker for her, that made be sooooooooooo happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sherean S. Munim

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Very easy to clean. I love this thing and now I'm not going back to a crockpot again. Heck when I first got it I practically used it daily.
customer_reviews.author: sgun73

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy cleanup. I'd give it 5 starts if it wasn't for the steam-escape valve--its really hard to tel when its up or down.
customer_reviews.author: oldwayz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we were looking for! Simple to operate. We made a 4 lb roast and it was so tender and amazing, just like Mom used to make with her old classic pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Queen Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I have ever bought ,once I figured out how to use it, directions are not that easy yo follow first time out.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Girl

customer_reviews.title: An instant crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I am very bad about putting meals in the slow cooker before I leave in the morning. This pressure cooker has saved me from ever really having to do that again. You can make all the same meals in a fraction of the time. It makes fabulous sticky rice too! I like it so much, I'm buying one for each of my kids. It is easy to us, and the flavors are really great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT "SOUTE OR BROWNING" BEFORE PRESSURE COOKING!
customer_reviews.text: Do not brown meats or vegetables in pressure cooker. The high temperature confuses the computer & cancels pressure cooking. Cuisinart customer service is not aware of this problem, so don't waste your time calling them. After eliminating the browning feature (suggested in Cuisinart manual) our Cuisinart Pressure Cooker has worked flawlessly for 4 years making great 7 minute soups, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E.  Adams

customer_reviews.title: review on pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pressure cooker for my daughter for Christmas,because I have one like it and don't know what I would do without it.I use it at least 3 times or more a week.It always preforms well Is easy to use and cleans up well.My daughter used to have one a different kind and it never worked right so she got rid of it and always says she wish's she had one like mine.If you have been afraid to use pressure cookers .this easy method will calm your fears and allow you to enjoy cheaper meats good recipe's and a much shorter cooking time.I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat 72

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love it : )
customer_reviews.text: we are so happy with this pressure cooker...read the booklet ,,followed instructions and are very happy ,,,fast easy way to make healthy foods,,,,the flavor is great,,easily digestible,,little water so vitamins don't leach out into the water,,,,the cooker looks great on the counter,,well made,,: ),
customer_reviews.author: georgette lee

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: The cuisinart pressure cooker is excellent. We use it routinely to cook beans / legumes, chicken+ dumplings, japanese mushroom broth, etc in only 30 minutes. Cooking a potato / leek soup took less time to make than driving to McDonald's and getting lunch there. This cooker makes it very easy to use grocery staples to reduce food costs, while still making food preparation convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This pressuer cooker is great and makes my life of cooking easier. The roasts & chicken are so tender & fall apart as well as taste wonderful. I was worried about the safety of using it as I have never used one before, but it is so easy & there are so many safety points built into it. The size is perfect & really does hold a lot of items. I read so many reviews about the different cookers & went with this one. It browns, sautes, and cooks high & low. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Not working for my family.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this appliance, but Ive used it twice and both times the meat came out tougher than it does in the oven or crock pot.
customer_reviews.author: ant221

customer_reviews.title: great little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Love all the uses this has! We have a small kitchen and space is at a premium, but this is worth it. We've only had it for a little over a month now, but have already made carnitas, chicken breasts, bbq tofu strips, beans (dry to done in 20 min), quinoa, rice and greens. My husband is a vegetarian and this has really helped him have easy quick meal options.
customer_reviews.author: V. Law

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and quality construction. I've used it a couple of times and although it has fewer gizmos than other products that are similar and much more expensive. This is a safe and useful kitchen tool and for us working woman helps us create great meals for our families and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Marla -- Fernley

customer_reviews.title: We have enjoyed every recipe I have used it for
customer_reviews.text: This appliance has been a godsend. We have enjoyed every recipe I have used it for. The pork tenderloin came out mouthwatering delicious and tender! You can find recipes online and they turn out very good! I would highly recommend this appliance for every home!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. I bought this item a few months ago. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. It doesn't reach pressure. I've read through the troubleshooting steps and called Cuisinart several times. Final solution was to return the item to Cuisinart (on my dime) and enclose a check for $10 for return postage. By the time I pay to have it shipped and then pay return postage, I might as well buy a new pressure cooker (a different brand of course). I think I'm done with pressure cookers.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and clean. Makes it easy to make any meat tender
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Greer

customer_reviews.title: love this cooker!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and the price, but most of all I love the results. I don't usually have a lot of time to cook things so I made this purchase. My first dish was pulled pork... it was delectable. Next I will try beans. Clean up wasn't too bad - just remove the inner piece. Warning: Don't overfill. Also comes with a book that will help you determine how long to cook certain foods.
customer_reviews.author: DST Diva

customer_reviews.title: Very good machine
customer_reviews.text: Have had good results with recipes included in the instruction book. I also own another electric pressure cooker--the Wolfgang Puck--and it works well too, but the Cuisinart seems to be a bit better engineered and constructed though the actual operation of the Cuisinart is not very intuitive. You will need to read the manual carefully to set up a project. All in all--well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: but so far it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a piece broken due to packaging, instructions on how to use are incorrect, but so far it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Naffster

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CPC-600 6 Quart 1000 Watt Electric Pressure Cooker (Stainless Steel)
product_meta.description:
Size:6-Quart| Style Name:2018

COOK FASTER, EAT HEALTHIER!
 Reduce time spent in the kitchen preparing meals with the help of this 6-quart electric pressure cooker--it cuts cooking times up to 70-percent when compared to traditional stovetop cooking methods. The unit traps steam inside, which builds up pressure to create hotter temperatures, and its tight seal locks in heat, moisture, and flavor, as well as vitamins and minerals for exceptionally healthy, great-tasting meals like soup, chili, and other one-dish entrees. It also works well for cheesecake and custard, because dessert should never be left off the menu. The unit's push-button controls and easy-to-read digital display eliminate guesswork, while its precision digital thermostat regulates temperatures. Choose from preprogrammed settings for high- or low-pressure cooking, browning, simmering, sauteing, and warming. For safety, the cooker must be fully locked for pressure to build, and it will remain locked until the pressure inside drops to zero. Other highlights include a 99-minute timer with an LED countdown display, cool-touch side handles, and a nonstick cooking pot that cleans up easily by hand or in the dishwasher. A dishwasher-safe trivet also comes included. Housed in brushed stainless steel, the 1000-watt pressure cooker measures 12-1/5 by 12-1/5 by 13-1/5 inches and carries a three-year limited warranty. 

 You're about to experience a better, faster, and healthier way of cooking. Your Cuisinart Electric Pressure Cooker seals in steam to cook hotter and faster, and it seals in nutrients as well. Cook in less water and experience textures and tastes that are simply sensational. Features easy touch-button settings, a countdown timer, and a cooking pot big enough for a pot roast with all the fixings. Enjoy! 

PRESSURE COOKER SETTINGS
• Low Pressure

• High Pressure

• Browning – This preset temperature allows cooking over high heat, without the lid, before pressure cooking. Browning foods in a small amount of fat in this way seals the outer surfaces of meats and vegetables, producing a visually appealing, flavorful exterior with a moist, tender interior. 

• Sauté – The preset temperature, done prior to pressure cooking with lid removed, allows you to quickly soften vegetables in a small amount of fat or liquid without browning, and to cook items such as rice (Arborio, brown, Carnaroli, white, etc.) for pilafs and risottos. 

• Simmer – This preset temperature allows you to cook liquids at a lower temperature. It is primarily used to finish cooking some items, i.e. to add ingredients to a risotto, sauce, or stew or to continue cooking process to achieve preferred texture. 

• Keep Warm – Holds and keeps cooked food warm for up to 12 hours. Automatic Keep Warm Feature: When LED display reaches, the pressure cooker automatically shifts to Keep Warm temperature. The Keep Warm light will turn on and unit will beep to indicate cooking is complete. 

PRODUCT FEATURES
 • 6-quart capacity
• Fingerprint-proof brushed stainless steel housing
• Digital thermostat
• Push button control for cooking options and programmed settings
• 99-minute time and LED countdown display 
• Cool-touch side handles
• Nonstick cooking pot
• Trivet included (dishwasher safe)
• Dishwasher-safe cooking pot
• 1000 watts
• Recipe book included
• Limited 3-year warranty

EFFORTLESS COOKING


 1.  With the unit on and the LED displayed, press the MENU button to select the desired cooking function. The function light will flash. 
 2.  
 3.  
 4.   Select Low or High Pressure setting.
 5.  
 6.  
 7.   Press TIME to select number of minutes needed for pressure cooking. Time increases in 1-minute increments up to 40 minutes. Time increases in 5-minute increments from 40 to 99 minutes. 
 8.  
 9.  
 10.  Press START/CANCEL to start cooking. The pressure cooker will begin to heat. The red float will rise as pressure builds. When the selected pressure level is reached, the light in lower right-hand corner of LED will stop flashing and remain lit. At this point pressure cooking begins and the timer will start to count down. The timer will not begin to count down until full pressure is reached, which may be several minutes after the red float has fully risen. 



RECIPE TIPS AND HINTS
 • Many family favorites can be easily adapted for preparation in your Cuisinart Electric Pressure Cooker – soups, stews, side dishes and more. 
• The amount of liquid needed is much less than for traditional cooking methods. 
• Never exceed the Maximum Fill Amount of the pressure cooker. 
• Make sure the lid is on firmly and tightly, and moved as far counterclockwise as it will go to allow proper locking. 
• Hot foods/liquids will come to pressure more quickly than cold foods/liquids. 
• When pressure cooking is completed, follow recipe instructions for releasing pressure. For Quick Pressure Release it is important to begin immediately upon completion of pressure cooking; otherwise foods will continue to cook, and may overcook. 
• Do not store pressure cooker with lid on tightly. This saves on gasket wear and tear. 
• More nutrients are preserved during pressure cooking than with traditional cooking methods, as less liquid is used and thus fewer nutrients are lost to evaporation. 
• To adapt your own recipes, find a similar one in our cookbook and use it as a guide. In general, cooking time will be at least 1⁄3 to . of the traditional cooking time. Reduce your cooking liquid by at least half – you may need to "play" with your recipe to get it right. You may wish to add vegetables at the end of cooking to avoid overcooking. You can also use the cooking charts provided as a guide.
feature_bullets: 6-quart electric pressure cooker reduces cooking times by 70 percent
BPA free.Push-button controls; easy-to-read digital display; precision thermostat
Settings for pressure cooking, browning, simmering, sauteing, and warming
Timer; cool-touch handles; nonstick dishwasher-safe cooking pot and trivet
Measures 12-1/5 by 12-1/5 by 13-1/5 inches; 3-year limited warranty
